text: Then the daughters of Zelophehad son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh of the families of Manasseh, the son of Joseph came forward. Now these are the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

And they <st data-num="05975" class="">stood</st> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> and <st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> and the <st data-num="05387" class="">leaders</st> of the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="05712" class="">assembly</st> at the <st data-num="06607" class="">entrance</st> to the <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st> of <st data-num="04150" class="">meeting</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>,

“Our father died in the wilderness, although he was not part of the company of those that gathered themselves together against the Lord in the company of Korah, but he died for his own sin, and he had no sons.
Why should the name of our father be lost from among his family because he had no son? Give us a possession among the relatives of our father.”
So Moses brought their case before the Lord.
The Lord said to Moses:

“The <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st> of <st data-num="06765" class="">Zelophehad</st> have a <st data-num="03651">valid</st> <st data-num="01696">claim</st>.<n id="1" /> You must <st data-num="05414">indeed</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> them <st data-num="0272" class="">possession</st> of an <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> <st data-num="08432" class="">among</st> their <st data-num="01" class="">father’s</st> <st data-num="0251" class="">relatives</st>, and you must <st data-num="05674" class="">transfer</st><n id="3" /> the <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> of their <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> to them.

And you must <st data-num="01696" class="">tell</st> the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st>, ‘<st data-num="03588">If</st> a <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">dies</st><n id="1" /> and <st data-num="0369">has no</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">son</st>, then you must <st data-num="05674" class="">transfer</st> his <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> to his <st data-num="01323">daughter</st>;

and <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> he <st data-num="0369">has no</st> <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st>, then you are to <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> his <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> to his <st data-num="0251">brothers</st>;

and <st data-num="0518" class="">if</st> he <st data-num="0369">has no</st> <st data-num="0251" class="">brothers</st>, then you are to <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> his <st data-num="05159" class="">inheritance</st> to his <st data-num="01">father’s</st> <st data-num="0251">brothers</st>;

and if his father has no brothers, then you are to give his inheritance to his relative nearest to him from his family, and he will possess it. This will be for the Israelites a legal requirement, as the Lord commanded Moses.’”
Then the Lord said to Moses, “Go up this mountain of the Abarim range, and see the land I have given to the Israelites.

When you have <st data-num="07200" class="">seen</st> it, you will be <st data-num="0622" class="">gathered</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> your <st data-num="05971" class="">ancestors</st>,<n id="2" /> as <st data-num="0175" class="">Aaron</st> your <st data-num="0251" class="">brother</st> was <st data-num="0622" class="">gathered</st> to his ancestors.<n id="3" />

For in the wilderness of Zin when the community rebelled against me, you rebelled against my command to show me as holy before their eyes over the water—the water of Meribah in Kadesh in the wilderness of Zin.”
Then Moses spoke to the Lord:
“Let the Lord, the God of the spirits of all humankind, appoint a man over the community,
who will go out before them, and who will come in before them, and who will lead them out, and who will bring them in, so that the community of the Lord may not be like sheep that have no shepherd.”
The Lord replied to Moses, “Take Joshua son of Nun, a man in whom is the Spirit, and lay your hand on him;

<st data-num="05975" class="">set</st> him<n id="1" /> <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> <st data-num="0499" class="">Eleazar</st> the <st data-num="03548" class="">priest</st> and <st data-num="06440" class="">before</st> the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st>, and <st data-num="06680" class="">commission</st><n id="2" /> him <st data-num="05869" class="">publicly</st>.<n id="3" />

Then you must <st data-num="01935" class="">delegate</st><n id="1" /> some of your <st data-num="01935" class="">authority</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05921">to</st> him, <st data-num="04616" class="">so that</st> the <st data-num="03605" class="">whole</st> <st data-num="05712" class="">community</st> of the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> will <st data-num="08085">be obedient</st>.<n id="3" />

And he will stand before Eleazar the priest, who will seek counsel for him before the Lord by the decision of the Urim. At his command they will go out, and at his command they will come in, he and all the Israelites with him, the whole community.”
So Moses did as the Lord commanded him; he took Joshua and set him before Eleazar the priest and before the whole community.
He laid his hands on him and commissioned him, just as the Lord commanded, by the authority of Moses.
